intro: Buchnera hermonthica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved buckler-vein, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Buchnera hermonthica typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. It produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
